title: Senior Health Care Program Planner Analyst L B/GME Administrator
description:
Woodhull Medical and Mental Health Center is attuned to the healthcare issues that matter to the people of North Brooklyn. Woodhull focuses on preventing disease and promoting healthy lifestyles by reaching out to the community at various locations.
   

  

 At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.
   

  

**Work Shifts** 
  

  

**9:00 AM - 5:00 PM** 
  

  


  

  

**PURPOSE OF POSITION:** 
  

  

 Under general supervision with latitude for independent judgment and initiative, serves as the administrative assistant to the GME department and to facilitate all student and residency program activities in GME.
   

  

**AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITIES:** 
  

  

 The Sr HCPPA Lev B/GME Administrator reports and assists the Director of Graduate Medical Education, Medical Education, and credentialing.
   

  

**SUMMARY OF DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:** 
  

 • Report directly to Director of GME to assist in all areas of GME.ACGME & CODA
   

 • IRIS reporting and responsible for IRIS readiness for all residency programs. Review all residents' demographics in preparation for IRIS and update accordingly.
   

 • New Innovations Data Management with Medicine, Pediatrics, OMS, Peds Dental, and General Dentistry. Review new resident's data and update current resident's data.
   

 • Maintains Duty Hours data regarding compliance with limits on educational and clinical work hours of trainees for institutional oversight; prepares annual report for IPRO/NYSDOH regarding work hour and supervision compliance; provides coordination with individual programs for periodic on-site IPRO/NYSDOH surveys.
   

 • Oversee in maintaining and checking various kinds of records pertaining to students, residents, and GME related items.
   

 • Manage all residency programs GME meetings and events.
   

 • Handles all methods of record management and correspondence.
   

 • Support and assist with preparation of ACGME Institutional and Program Site Visits.
   

 • Maintains required GME institutional policies; prepares and updates as needed for GMEC committee review.
   

 • Responsible for processing and maintaining HHC purchase orders & reimbursements.
   

 • Collect and process the residents holiday reimbursements.
   

 • Coordinator for Graduate Medical Education Committee, Facility-Based, and Wellbeing Subcommittee; prepares and circulates agendas and minutes; maintains attendance records.
   

 • Facilitate the process of new and promotional contracts for all house staff training through Woodhull's residency and fellow programs.
   

 • Assists with the Students & Affiliates applications, verifies credentials, collects required information from medical students, external residents, and other students.
   

 • Issues ID forms and Epic access.
   

 • Handles and coordinates other large scale GME activities such as Incoming House Staff Orientation.
   

 • Attend all GME functions including meetings, trainings, seminars, workshops and monitor residents' compliance.
   

 • Responsible in preparing and arranging for services and activities in connection with receptions and other public functions. Resident Graduation ceremonies, Residents Research Day, Residents Day, Clinical Wellness, Forums, RNEO, and BBN.
   

 • Preparation and closing of GME related projects and events.
   

 • Effectively utilizes various computer applications or other automated systems such as spreadsheets, word processing, calendar, e-mail, Power point, Survey Monkey and database/statistical software in performing work assignments.
   

 • Preparation of data and analysis of information for on-going oversight of GME programs at Woodhull including, but not limited to IPRO, CMMS, NYSDOH, ACGME, and CODA.
   

 • Function as a liaison between the DIO, Chair, faculty, other departments, and institutions as needed.
   

 • Identifies opportunities for improvements in methods, procedures and organization to increase efficiency in GME team operations.
   

 • Other clerical duties as assigned including special assignments.
   

 • Responsible for wearing professional attire.
   

 • Participate in all departmental activities, in-services, and all hospital-wide training.
   

  

**Minimum Qualifications** 
  

 1. A Baccalaureate Degree from an accredited college or university in Business Administration, Engineering or Social Sciences, Health Care Specialization, Physical Sciences or related programs; and
   

 A minimum of four years of progressive, responsible experience related to Health Care Program Planning, Research, Design, Operation, Evaluation and Analysis; or
   

 2. A Masters Degree from an accredited college or university in Public Health, Public or Hospital Administration, Health Care Specialization, Business Administration or related disciplines; and
   

 A minimum of three years progressive, responsible experience directly related to health care program planning, research, design, operation, evaluation and analysis; or
   

 3. A satisfactory equivalent combination of training, education and experience; and,
   

 4. Demonstrated skills in written and oral communication.
   

  

 NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:
   




* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**COMPANY:** 
 Canoe Intelligence
 



**WEBSITE** 
 : https://canoeintelligence.com/
 



**TITLE:** 
 Senior Machine Learning Engineer
 



**LOCATION:** 
 New York City (hybrid) or Fully Remote in the United States
 



**SALARY** 
 : $140,000 - $210,000 dependent on level of hire (based on NYC, will be adjusted for GEO)
 



**The Role:** 




 We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to dive into a hyper growth startup developing models that improve our data processing pipeline and help us deliver new features to the market with unprecedented speed and accuracy.
 







**What You’ll Do:** 



* NLP Algorithm Development: Lead the design and implementation of state-of-the-art NLP algorithms, with a focus on information extraction, entity resolution, and entity disambiguation.
* Model Training and Optimization: Develop and train large language models for various NLP tasks, optimizing their performance for accuracy, efficiency, and scalability.
* Data Preprocessing and Feature Engineering: Work closely with data engineering teams to preprocess and engineer features from large datasets to enhance the performance of machine learning models.
* Entity Resolution and Disambiguation: Drive the development of solutions for entity resolution and disambiguation challenges, ensuring robust and accurate identification of entities within unstructured text.
* Collaboration with Cross-functional Teams: Collaborate with product managers, software engineers, and other stakeholders to integrate machine learning models into end-to-end solutions.
* Research and Innovation: Stay abreast of the latest advancements in NLP and machine learning, and actively contribute to research initiatives to enhance our technology stack.
* Code Review and Mentorship: Conduct code reviews to ensure code quality and provide mentorship to junior members of the machine learning team.







**What We’re Looking For:** 



* Minimum of 5 years of experience in machine learning, with a focus on NLP.
* Proven experience in information extraction, entity resolution, and entity disambiguation.
* Proficiency in Python and relevant machine learning libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
* Experience with deep learning architectures, especially those applied to NLP tasks.
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field.



***Preferred:***



* Master Degree or PhD in computer science or related field.
* Experience in training and deploying large language models.
* Familiarity with cloud computing platforms and distributed computing.
* Familiarity with modern ML Ops tools such as Modal, Weights and Biases, Sagemaker, etc.







**What You’ll Get:** 
  




* Medical, dental, vision benefits
* Flexible PTO
* 401(k)
* Flexible work from home policy
* Home office stipend + wifi reimbursement
* Employee Assistance Program
* Gym reimbursement
* Education assistance
* Parental Leave
* Commuter benefits





**Our Values:** 



* Client First —> Listen, and deliver client-centric solutions
* Be An Owner —> Take initiative, improve situations, drive positive outcomes
* Excellence —> Always set the highest standard for yourself and others
* Win Together —> 1 + 1 = 3



**Who We Are:** 




 Canoe is reimagining alternative investment data processes for hundreds of leading institutional investors, capital allocators, asset servicing firms and wealth managers. By combining industry expertise with the most sophisticated data capture technologies, Canoe’s technology automates the highly-frustrating, time-consuming, and costly manual workflows related to alternative investment document and data management, extraction and delivery. With Canoe, clients can refocus capital and human resources on business performance and growth, increase efficiency, and gain deeper access to their data. Canoe’s AI-driven platform was developed in 2013 for Portage Partners LLC, a private investment firm.
 



 Canoe is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

description:

 Business Associate

title: Assistant Chief Engineer - OWTC
description:
For 100 years, The Durst Organization has been a family-run business dedicated to the principles of innovation, integrity, community, and sustainability. We develop, build, own, and manage premier office towers and residential buildings that set new standards in environmental responsibility and user efficiency. Our enduring relationships with our tenants and partners are critical to our success and have made us generations of builders, building for generations.
   

  

 We build, own, and operate many of the worlds most innovative and efficient buildings. We create value for our tenants and partners by developing sustainable residential and commercial properties in which people live, work, and thrive.
   





 The successful candidate will supervise the Engineering crew to complete work orders and inspections as required under the direction of the Chief Engineer. We are looking for candidate who can lead by example and work independently in a fast paced environment on complex systems. This job will require a candidate with strong administrative skills and leadership qualities.
 



  
 



 This role will be based at One World Trade Center and is a Local 94 union position.
 



  
 



**The shift and schedule for this position will be Monday-Friday from 10:00pm - 6:00am.** 




  
 


  


 • Initiates or responds to work orders, assigns to staff as applicable, follows-up and verifies completion of work, and works with the Chief Engineer to expedite and get approval of payments for completed work.
   

 • Assist Chief Engineer in handling requests for service calls, evaluating requests, and dispatching appropriate staff and contractors. Knowledge on creating, closing and tracking work requests in Aware Manager.
   

 • Monitor performance and note deficiencies of service contractors and recommend changes as necessary.
   

 • Consult Chief Engineer on maintenance and repair of HVAC equipment and systems, machinery, energy systems, roofs, Fire/Life safety, and other building systems.
   

 • Perform preventive and predictive maintenance inspections/repairs as directed and as mandated by local municipalities and building requirements on systems such as: fire suppression and sprinkler systems, fire extinguishers, support backflow prevention device testing, and, if qualified, HVAC systems.
   

 • Manage monthly or periodic inspections of building systems, i.e., HVAC, electrical distribution, structural, roofs. Prepare detailed report of exceptions and recommend corrective action.
   

 • Maintain compliance with building regulations and permits (equipment use, Certificate of Occupancy, etc.). As directed, correct violations requiring plumbing repairs. File with appropriate agencies.
   

 • Maintain the building operation manual and train building personnel.
   

 • Utilize engineering and technical resources to continuously assess, analyze and improve operational effectiveness, and achieve overall building operational performance.
   

 • Provide technical support for the facility in terms of plant operations, operations cost control, and overall equipment effectiveness.
   

 • Practice proper PPE compliance and maintain a safe working record and environment.
   

 • Supervise maintenance team in order to achieve operational goals. This includes employee training, instructing and advising employees on procedures and guidelines.
   

 • Assures all projects are in compliance with Durst standards.
   

 • Maintains plant appearance and ensures repairs are noted and completed on a timely basis
   

 • Manages spare and critical room inventory.
   

 • Ensures that unsafe conditions are corrected in a timely manner.
   

 • Maintain and build job skills through company training programs
   

 • Establish and maintain relationships within all departments with communication and understanding of needs and expectations.
   

 • Perform other related duties and responsibilities as assigned by Chief Engineer
   

 • On call 24/7 for building emergencies, shutdowns.
 


  


 • Valid New York City Fire Department Refrigeration Machine Operator License with a minimum of five year’s contiguous work experience.
   

 • Completion of Local 94 Training Program.
   

 • Position will entail providing administrative support to the Chief Engineer - proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Word is required.
   

 • Working knowledge of software (AWARE Manager or equivalent) - generating and closing Work Orders, tracking equipment repair history, equipment database management and administration. Ability to track and manage parts and material inventory, generate requisitions and/or Purchase Orders to maintain stock above predetermined levels.
   

 • Experience in the operation of multi stage direct expansion (DX) water-cooled packaged AC equipment and Modular Chillers.
   

 • Sprinkler/Standpipe Certification – S12 / S13 Certificates of Fitness along with various FDNY certs.
   

 • Schneider Electric Andover Systems BMS software system or equivalent BATC control system experience
   

 • Knowledge of construction (MEP, Architectural, schematic) drawings for service and troubleshooting systems.
   

 • Experience with Steam heating systems, Electrical Systems and Fire Protection Systems
   

 • Knowledge of Emergency Power Systems – Generators, Diesel transfer pump system, Automatic Transfer Switches and Priority Control Switchgear.
   

 • Proficient in pipe soldering, brazing and threading
   

 • Proficient in mechanical repairs of fans, pumps and DX A/C units
   

 • Minimum of five year’s basic electrical experience – System troubleshooting and electrical component replacement.
   

 • Minimum of five year’s plumbing experience – Piping system repairs, bathroom fixture repairs and drain clearing.
   

 • Proven work record of safe work practices and efficient time management skills
   

 • All required certificates for building operation.
 



  
 



**Candidates will be required to be screened by Secure Worker Access Consortium (SWAC) background check. Screening details available in web link below.** 




 http://www.secureworker.com/assets/downloads/3.0.1-Background\\_Screening\\_Criteria.pdf
 



  
 



**Site access requires completion of OSHA Safety & Health Course (10 hours)** 



  

 Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer: Minorities/Female/Disabled/Veteran

title: Commercial Roofing Project Manager
description:
**Description** 




 With a history dating back to 1906, Chris Andersen Roofing, a Tecta America
 
 Company, has served New Jersey’s commercial and industrial market for roof replacement, restoration, repair, and preventative maintenance. Chris Andersen has become one of the most respected roofing contractors by upholding a customer service philosophy and standard that fosters long term customer relationships. We apply the most exacting standards in materials and workmanship and use the most highly trained professionals in the industry. We stand behind our work with a guarantee our roofing projects are water-tight and built to last. 
 

  
 

 We are currently seeking a Commercial Roofing Project Manager for our Hopelawn, NJ location. 
 

  
 

 The Project Manager role is responsible for estimating, scheduling, operating and managing projects from cradle to grave. The Project Manager ensures that all associated work is performed in a timely and cost-effective manner, in accordance with applicable plans and specifications, company policies and procedures along with sound roofing practices. The Project Manager reports to the Operating Unit President. 
 

  
 

**Primary Responsibilities:** 
  
 
* Understand the contract to ensure the Company’s responsibilities and scope of the work
* Responsible for catching deviations from the specifications and plans as it relates to scope, contract and schedule
* Generate estimates from blueprint drawings, specifications, field notes, field drawings, and actual field inspections
* Obtain all necessary information, such as: field inspections, measurements, photographs, and sketches required to provide accurate customer pricing
* Submit proposals to customers
* Communicate with owners, architects, engineers, general contractors and property managers
* Attend/conduct all weekly meetings in conjunctions with project start-up, pre-bid, sales, job progress
* Generate project budgets, submittals, equipment requirements, purchase orders, material lists, manpower requirements, lodging, and transportation
* Handle all safety issues
* Conduct pre-job safety analysis of each project
* Monitor job costs against original estimates, budgets and change orders
* Manage project closeouts and ensure warranty documents are requested and received
* Execute contracts with subcontractors
* Month end WIP report and cost to complete report



**Knowledge, Skills & Experience:** 
  
 
* High School Diploma or equivalent, college preferred (Construction Management)
* Minimum three (3) years of roofing or construction industry experience.
* Critical skills include planning & organizing; problem identification/resolution, follow-through, priority setting, and a sense of urgency in accomplishing tasks.
* Strong attention to detail.
* Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project)
* Must have a valid driver's license
* Able to lift up to 50 pounds and comfortable visiting actual job sites about 50% of the time (without fear of heights)
* Ability to speak, read and comprehend instructions, short correspondence and policy documents, as well as converse comfortably with associates.
* Knowledge of business and management principles
* Familiarity with project management software.
* Extensive knowledge of roofing materials, techniques and requirements



 Chris Anderson Roofing, a Tecta America Company, offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401(k) with company match, paid time off, paid holidays, etc.

title: Jenbacher Gas Engine Mechanical Engineer
description:
Prismecs is at the forefront of transforming energy solutions on a global scale. As trailblazers in supply chain and engineering, we empower industrial teams to break through barriers in sectors like power generation and oil & gas. With a strategic presence in key markets around the globe. We're not just a company; we're a dynamic global force.
 



 Prismecs merges domain expertise with cutting-edge innovation, especially in sectors such as power generation, oil & gas, metals, mining, and data centers. We specialize in tailoring solutions for maximum uptime, offering an unparalleled platform for your skills to thrive. If you're driven to make a tangible impact in the industrial realm, envision yourself contributing to a team at Prismecs that prioritizes reliability and integrity at every stage.
 



 We are seeking highly skilled and experienced Jenbacher Engine Mechanical Engineers to join our team. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in the installation, commissioning, and maintenance of Jenbacher J616-101 and associated equipment gas engines. This position requires a strong engineering background, problem-solving skills, and a deep understanding of gas engine technology.
 



**Start Date:** 
 Immediately
 



**Location:** 
 This job is located on-site at a customer location.
 



**Responsibilities** 



* Perform site assessments and prepare for engine installations.
* Install Jenbacher J616-101 engines and associated equipment according to manufacturer guidelines and project specifications.
* Ensure all installations meet safety and regulatory standards.
* Conduct pre-commissioning checks and tests.
* Start-up and commission Jenbacher J616-101 engines, ensuring optimal performance.
* Perform routine and preventive maintenance on Jenbacher J616-101 engines.
* Diagnose and repair engine faults and malfunctions.
* Conduct regular inspections and maintenance of ancillary equipment.
* Keep detailed records of maintenance activities and engine performance.
* Provide technical support and guidance to clients and team members.
* Assist in the training of junior technicians and operators on the operation and maintenance of Jenbacher engines.
* Stay updated with the latest technical information and advancements related to Jenbacher engines.
* Adhere to all safety protocols and procedures.
* Ensure compliance with environmental and regulatory standards.
* Ability and willingness to work in rotation shifts, including holidays, weekends and overtime as required by field assignments.
* Extensive travel to and from projects and various field assignments will be required.
* May be assigned other duties to help proactively drive our Company's vision and align with our organization's core values.



**Required Skills** 




**Field Service Engineers with knowledge of:** 



* Gas Engines
* Generators
* Electric Motors & Pumps
* Instruments
* Servomechanisms
* Actuators
* Fire-Fighting systems
* Machinery knowledge
* Experience and training on Jenbacher gas engines and associated equipment gas engines.
* Pipe fitting and tubing experience.



**Qualifications** 



* Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience working with Jenbacher gas engines, particularly the J616 model.
* In-depth knowledge of gas engine mechanics, control systems, and electrical systems.
* Proficient in using diagnostic and monitoring software for gas engines.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret performance data and make informed decisions.
* Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
* Effective communication and leadership skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
* Commitment to safety and adherence to all safety protocols and standards.
* English proficiency (reading, writing, and speaking).
* CMMS system knowledge and experience.
* Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Office Knowledge.
* HSE General Basic Knowledge. Knowledge of ISO 9001, ISO 14000, and OHSAS 18001 (a plus).



**Preferred Qualifications:** 



* Master's degree in Engineering or a related field.
* Certification in gas engine maintenance or related technical fields.
* Experience with emissions testing and compliance.
* Familiarity with SCADA systems and other industrial control systems.



**Applicants must submit CV/ Resume in English** 




 Join Prismecs where your potential knows no bounds and be part of a dynamic team dedicated to shaping the future of industrial excellence.

title: Fabricator & Installer (at New Project)
description:
**Full-time:** 
 $18-35/hr (commensurate to experience from entry-level to experienced)
   


**Company** 
  

 New Project is a fabrication and design firm specializing in custom builds for artists, architects and interior designers, museums and galleries, retail, and branded environments. From design assist, technical problem-solving, and prototyping through to project management, fabrication, and installation, our creatives and technical specialists develop innovative solutions for even the most complex projects. Our backgrounds in art, architecture, and engineering with a shared passion for experimenting with new materials and methodologies inform our process.
 



**Summary of Position** 
  

 This person is responsible for the efficient execution of fabrication and installation of artwork, furniture, exhibit and commercial displays, and custom fabrication of unique objects.
 


**Responsibilities** 
  

* Maintaining an organized a safe work environment
* Attention to detail and quality is required
* Knowledge and use of common hand tools and fabrication equipment, such as table saw, planer, joiner, sander, and drill press
* Be able to follow directions from Project Leads and Managers
* Ability to learn to communicate clearly about the details of the project via project management software
* Be able to read and work from shop drawings
* Move & Lift 60 lbs
* Must be able to work during normal business hours Monday through Friday from 9:00AM to 5:00PM
* Must be able to work a flexible work schedule and have the ability to work overtime on short notice, including weekends as required
* Must be able to stay focused on independent tasks and communicate as a part of a larger team


  

***Good Help Post:** 
 Good Help is a no-cost initial recruiting service that promotes active job openings on behalf of employers in Brooklyn. This is a Good Help job post and not for direct hire at the Brooklyn Chamber of Commerce.*

title: Program Coordinator
description:
**About the Position** 
  

  

 We are looking for an enthusiastic Program Coordinator to help us organize and run a variety of internal programs, including our tech internships, software engineering rotational program, various week-long programs for high school and college students, and a number of our internal education offerings for full-time employees across different departments.
   

  

 You will work with the rest of our team to execute the day-to-day tasks involved with running our programs, improve the ways we talk about our programs, and track feedback and historical data. Additional responsibilities of the role will include:
   

* Project managing and executing high impact programs
* Scheduling classes, events, and meetings for internal programs
* Creating and following up on feedback surveys for each week's programs
* Collaborating with stakeholders on program strategy, planning, and execution
* Scheduling planning meetings for upcoming programs and events
* Soliciting full-time employees to help with our various programs
* Communicating relevant program information to participants and program content creators
* Keeping relevant program calendars, documentation, and infrastructure up to date


  

 We are looking for someone who works hard, is eager to jump into a fast-paced environment, and can think big-picture while getting the tiny details right.
   

**About You** 
  

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent relevant practical experience
* 3+ years of experience in program/project management or a related field
* Self-starter with strong organizational skills
* Able to handle competing priorities in a challenging, fast-paced environment
* Meticulous attention to detail and strong administrative skills
* Approachable and humble attitude; not afraid to ask for help when needed
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Excellent stakeholder and meeting management skills
* Able to think big picture and evolve programs based on user feedback
* Positive, professional attitude and presence
* No financial industry experience required


  

 If you're a recruiting agency and want to partner with us, please reach out to agency-partnerships@janestreet.com.

title: Senior Network Security Engineer - Proxy-Based Edge SWG
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Network Security Engineer with extensive experience in designing and engineering proxy-based Edge Secure Web Gateway (SWG) solutions. In this role, you will focus on developing robust network security products, including perimeter security and connectivity for on-premises, internet, and public cloud environments. Your expertise will be crucial in enhancing our Secure Service Edge (SSE) and SASE solutions, and you will play a key role in developing new features and maintaining high standards for our products.
   

  

 AllSTEM is committed to guiding your career progression and to transforming the way hiring happens. We are big believers in that people matter and a job search should be effortless and enjoyable. If this sounds like the process, you are looking for then.
   

 APPLY TODAY!
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

 Research, design, and engineer network security products with a focus on proxy-based Edge SWG solutions.
   

 Develop and manage perimeter network security and connectivity, encompassing on-premises, internet, and public cloud environments.
   

 Utilize hands-on experience with Palo Alto SSE/SASE solutions and cloud security architectures.
   

 Design solutions, introduce new feature requirements, and address client needs effectively.
   

 Develop and maintain scripts for device pave/repave and automate day-to-day tasks.
   

 Establish and uphold engineering standards and create artifacts for certified products.
   

 Oversee hardware and software certifications.
   

 Act as the escalation point for Network Operations and Service Delivery teams.
   

 Collaborate cross-functionally with stakeholders to ensure cohesive project execution.
   

 Required Qualifications:
   

  

 5+ years of experience in network security design, engineering, and implementation within a large enterprise environment.
   

 5+ years of experience in designing and engineering proxy-based Edge SWG, Secure Service Edge (SSE), and SASE solutions.
   

 Proven experience with other SWG and SSE vendors, including Palo Alto, Zscaler, and Netskope.
   

 Proficiency in software development and scripting languages such as Python, Ansible, Terraform, and JSON.
   

 Experience with microservices, CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins), and APIs.
   

 BS/BA degree or equivalent practical experience.
   

 Preferred Qualifications:
   

  

 In-depth experience with SASE, SSE, and SWG solutions.
   

 Familiarity with internet and cloud DMZ architecture and load balancing techniques.
   

 Experience with employee remote access solutions.
   

 Knowledge of stateful and application layer firewall technologies is a plus.
   

 Experience working with Agile methodologies such as Kanban and Scrum
   

 #3411

 Understanding Matters.
   

 We actively listen to each other, our STEM professionals, and customers. We take the time to understand their needs to make the best connections in the industry.

title: Manufacturing Engineer
description:
We are an HVAC Contracting company seeking a Manufacturing Engineer to assist the Engineering Manager on Sales Inquiries and Manufacturing Support.
   

  



**Job Description:**
  


* Oversee all quality control functions including first article, in-process and final inspections, performance testing and incoming goods inspection.
* Provide support to manufacturing including trouble-shooting and failure analysis.
* process RMAs - inspection and estimate of repairs - focusing on product quality issues.
* Identify quality issues and recommend solutions.
* Develop, evaluate and improve manufacturing processes.
* Initiate ECN to implement the change and follow through the change to ensure success.
* Investigate quality issues generated by RMA's and customer inquiries and react with MRB's or ECN as required to initiate corrective action.
* Shop Routings (Job Confirmation) for assigned product codes
* Review and maintain existing routing prior to production and job confirmation
* Make sure drawing is up to date
* Review job quantity, EBQ, structure and routing, drawing
* Recommend substitute or alternate manufacture when required
* Review imploded cost and request cost change if required
* Material Number Creation and Costing/Maintenance
* Update the ERP system with regards to tracking information and material descriptions
* Maintain stock codes/part numbers - including description, structure and routing, EBQ and cost of Procurement of Material.
* Use technical knowledge of industry to order necessary material, equipment and machinery parts.
* Source required suppliers and material for jobs and projects.
* Communicate equipment/material needs to suppliers and negotiate costs and contracts.
* Inspect materials for quality assurance.



**Qualifications:**
  


* Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering required
* 4+ years experience in product manufacturing
* Strong knowledge of CAD/CAM software and drafting procedures

title: Manager of R&D System Build and Design PLC Control Systems Engineering
company: Expanding New Jersey Company, Unique Recession-Resistant Industry
description:
**Newly Created role with an Expanding Company, Managerial Culture towards utilizing the best available technology and tools to increase customer satisfaction and maximize profitability.** 




**Extremely Bright and Collaborative Teams Focused Environment; History of Internal Promotions.** 




***"Due to our position in the marketplace and massive interest in our technology, we are in major expansion mode"***




***Desired Skills/Experience/Profile:***



* A Desire to leverage your PLC-Systems (SCADA, DCS, HMI, Process control or similar) Knowledge and Experience within a Managerial Role (where you will be the point person for ideas, recommendations, suggestions [based on your research, knowledge and experience for building and customizing PLC based systems).
* Experience Directly Managing and Supervising a small or medium sized team of Electrical Engineers who design and build PLC based Electronic Control Systems; should have experience with most of the following:
 *hiring, firing, mentoring, training, PTO requests/approvals, performance reviews, R&D/Design-Build Team work flow (including hours-estimation for build projects, technology/Hardware/Parts needs-ordering-timing), Project Managing overall Systems Research-Design-Builds, Related Metrics Reporting, Use of an ERP system for parts-Hardware needs management and related areas.*
* Experience working in a similar role where you have been the System-Build team's Point-Person and Main-Communicator to other teams including:
 *Sales and Sales Support; Manufacturing (PCB and wiring teams), Accounting, Upper Level Management, External Clients, Software Development, Stock-Inventory, Field Service, Customer Service.*
* Experience designing and building or heavily customizing PLC Based Systems (SCADA, DCS, HMI, Process control or similar):
 *should have experience with* 
	+ Ladder Logic and PLC Programming
	+ Connectivity of PLC based system to a network (wireless, ethernet, cloud or other) including some knowledge of Related Networking (profi-bus, mod-bus, ethernet, wireless, 232/385 or similar industrial networking areas)
	+ Data Acquisition within PLC based systems and using or designing systems that extract data (and store or report on data) coming off of the the system (experience with SQL Server or another SQL based Database is preferred).
	+ Electrical Schematics (Blue-Prints, One Line Diagrams or similar)...should have familiarity with AutoCAD.
	+ Related Embedded and Applications Software Knowledge or Experience
	+ Functional Area of PLC Based Systems including S.O.P. usage and safety protocols and documentation (ISO experience is a plus), lists of parts that are in the system (or that will be used to build the system.
* A College Degree in Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Physics, Math, Electro-Mechanical Engineering and/or formal training-study on PLC Based Electronic Control Systems; Must have a solid background in Electronics Fundamentals.



***Competitive Compensation and a Very Good Benefits Package.***




***Call or Apply Today!***






### 
 About Expanding New Jersey Company, Unique Recession-Resistant Industry:




 New Jersey Based Company using state of the art technology within our systems and products, Recession-Resistant B2B customer Base, Currently in Major Growth Mode: Hiring in several different departments, history of internal promotions, recently implemented profit sharing plan, collaborative-communicative team based environment.

title: Property Accountant - Affordable Housing
description:
**Property Accountant** 




 Paths is a full-scale, vertically integrated affordable housing developer, builder, and operator.  Since 2004, the Paths team created and preserved high-quality affordable housing across the U.S. that enhances communities and helps residents build better lives. With over 12,000 units across 10 states under management and more than 400 employees, Paths manages a suite of capabilities spanning the entire property life-cycle, including: development, construction, property management, maintenance, and security.
 








**Summary/Objective:** 




 Reporting to the Property Accountant Manager, the Property Accountant will have full responsibility for managing the day to day accounting practices for the assigned portfolio.
 








**Classification:** 
 Exempt
 



**Hybrid schedule – 3 days in office/2 days work from home** 




**Essential function/Responsibilities: duties include but are not limited to the following** 



* Reconcile bank statements monthly.


* Journalize various expenses monthly.
* Review the general ledger for inaccuracies monthly.
* Ensure subsidiary ledgers match the trial balance.
* Produce monthly reports.
* Process security deposits.
* Enter adjusting journal entries.
* Assist with year-end close and audit preparation.
* Oversees payroll processes
* Guides accounting team members on various task and inquiries








**Requirements:** 



* Must have a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting
* 5+ years of accounting experience within the real estate industry; residential/affordable experience preferred, commercial a plus.
* Working knowledge of Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable
* Must be proficient Microsoft applications - Word and Excel
* Prefer a working knowledge of Yardi Voyager software
* Strong organization skills
* Ability to work independently as well as in a team
* Self-starter who is willing to take initiative on tasks
* Superior Customer Service skills required
* Ability to multi-task, prioritize and work efficiently
* Strong capability to communicate effectively both verbally and written, including giving and receiving feedback with all levels within the organization
* Ability to perform at high levels in a fast paced, ever-changing work environment



  
 



**Salary Range: $80,000 - 85,000 annually** 




  
 



**Benefits:** 



* We pay 100% of medical benefits, for employee only. Dental, vision and additional benefit selections plan options also available.
* 401 (K) available plus company match
* Paid Time Off & Holidays
* Commuter Benefits
* STD, LTD, life insurance, dependent coverage



  
 





### 
 About Paths Management Services, LLC:




 Paths is a full-scale, vertically integrated affordable housing developer, builder, and operator. Since 2004, the Paths team created and preserved high-quality affordable housing across the U.S. that enhances communities and helps residents build better lives. With over 12,000 units across 10 states under management and more than 400 employees, Paths manages a suite of capabilities spanning the entire property life-cycle, including: development, construction, property management, maintenance, and security.

title: Tool Maker
description:
\\*\\*Job Summary:\\*
 



 We are seeking a skilled Machinist/Toolmaker to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, fabricating, and repairing precision tools and fixtures using a variety of manual and CNC equipment and techniques. Experience with threading molybdenum (moly) with a manual lathe is required.
 



 \\*\\*Responsibilities:\\*\\*
 



 -Responsible for producing our in-house manufactured tooling
 



 -Machine, turn, and mill refractory metals, mainly molybdenum (moly), in our toolroom
 



 -Machine, turn, and mill steel in our toolroomWork with CNC lathe, drill press, mill
 



 -Perform a variety of machine setups and operations
 



 -Assist in the design of tooling and procedures to properly and efficiently manufacture the company's products
 



 -Document machine setup data and tooling design specifications, maintain all related records and files, and update as needed
 



 -Perform machine maintenance and repairs as required using hand tools if necessary
 



 Read and interpret specifications and reference manuals to perform repairs and machine/design tooling.
 



 -Repair and replace tooling as required and production machinery as required
 



 -Work to develop new tooling designs and manufacturing procedures to expand the company’s product line
 



 -Directly manufacture products as needed
 



 -Perform special projects as directed
 



 - Utilize CAD software such as AutoCAD and SolidWorks to design tools
 



 - Use precision measuring instruments to ensure accuracy in tool fabrication
 



 - Interpret engineering drawings with GD&T specifications
 



 - Program CAM software for tool production
 



 - Fabricate tools and fixtures according to specifications
 



 - Maintain and repair existing tools as needed
 



 \\*\\*Qualifications:\\*\\*
 



 -High school degree or technical school degree and 10+ years of machinist experience are required
 



 -Experience with Manual/Conventional and CNC Lathe is required
 



 -Experience with Manual Mill and Surface Grinder is required
 



 -Experience machining molybdenum (moly) is required knowledge of machine controls and the ability/understanding to make adjustments to regulate precision tolerances of .001 to .0001 is critical
 



 - Proficiency in CAD software like AutoCAD and SolidWorks
 



 - Experience with lathe operation and machining techniques
 



 - Familiarity with precision measuring instruments
 



 - Knowledge of GD&T principles for interpreting engineering drawings
 



 - Ability to program CAM software for tool production
 



 - Strong mechanical knowledge of tool fabrication
 



 - Previous experience in tool making or related field
 



 This position offers an exciting opportunity for a skilled Toolmaker to contribute to our team. We encourage you to apply if you meet the qualifications and want to showcase your tool design and fabrication expertise.
 



 Job Type: Full-time
 



 Expected hours: 40 per week
 



 Benefits:
 



 401(k)
 



 Paid time off
 



 Schedule:
 



 8-hour shift
 



 Day shift
 



 Monday to Friday
 



 No weekends
 



 Experience:
 



 CNC lathe: 3 years (Required)
 



 Machining: 5 years (Required)
 



 Manual Lathe: 5 years (Required)
 



 Threading Molybdenum (Moly): 3 years (Required)
 



 Ability to Commute:

title: Senior Back End Software Engineer - MSP Team
description:
About The Role
 
 Abnormal Security is looking for a Software Engineer to join the Inbound Email Products (IEP) team. The IEP team builds & operates core components of Abnormal's flagship Email Security product, such as Remediation Flows & Customer Portal Dashboards. This is a full stack team which is responsible for all the layers, including data storage, backend & frontend. The ideal candidate will have worked across the stack and has in depth knowledge about backend & distributed computing.
 


 What You Will Do
 * Work with the Tech Lead, Engineering Manager & Product Manager to craft the roadmap for the IEP team.
* Lead Software Projects which are critical to Abnormal's success with a group of engineers, through conception, design, implementation, launch & operation.
* Provide guidance and mentorship for junior members of the team
* Collaborate with Technical Program Managers, Product Managers, Go-ToMarket teams in order to implement, verify and iterate on the issues & requests coming from our customers
* Raise the bar of excellence in engineering, actively contributing to knowledge sharing within the team and participating in professional development activities.


 Must Have
 * Experience with our stack: Python, Go
* BS degree in Computer Science, Applied Sciences, Information Systems or other related engineering field
* 5+ years of industry experience on backend web development & distributed systems, designing & building software applications
* Experience working individually as well as in groups on a regular basis
* Experience working with distributed teams, proficient in asynchronous and written communication
* Experience building features & components from scratch and operating them, balancing feature development work with operational tasks


 Nice To Have
 * Experience with our stack: AWS, K8s, Django, Spark, Prometheus
* Knowledge of containerization using Docker or similar technologies.












---



  

 At Abnormal Security certain roles are eligible for a bonus, restricted stock units (RSUs), and benefits. Individual compensation packages are based on factors unique to each candidate, including their skills, experience, qualifications and other job-related reasons. We know that benefits are also an important piece of your total compensation package. Learn more about our Compensation and Equity Philosophy on our Benefits & Perks page.
 




 Base salary range:
 

 $175,800—$206,800 USD

title: Software Engineer
description:
QRL (Quant Risk Libraries) implements risk models to ensure that the bank's lending portfolios have adequate capital during crisis. We use mathematical modeling and the latest technologies to build loss forecasting and stress testing pipelines. Our systems are responsible for calculating risk on some of the largest portfolios in Citi.
 







 We are a diverse group of professionals with backgrounds in Physics, Engineering and Computer Science. You will work alongside experienced colleagues to further develop your analytical and quantitative skills. You will build skills in building products from the ground up for solving real life problems and develop a career as a risk model expert.
 







**You will be responsible for:** 



* Designing and implement a framework for model driven computations on a graph
* Designing and building infrastructure APIs for grid computing, data storage and access
* Unit testing, reliability and improving the quality of our compute pipelines
* Learn about Python, its ecosystem, community and best practices
* Ideas on improving our model and data platform and help implement them



**You will need:** 



* Bachelors, Masters or Ph.D. in Computer Science/Computer Engineering or related field
* At least 3-5 years of professional Software Development experience
* 2+ years developing Python, C or C++ packages and API development
* Strong grasp of computing fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, OS, programming languages.
* Fluency in Python and working knowledge of a compiled language like C/C++/Java
* Exposure to Numerical libraries (Pandas/Numpy) and data processing
* Ability for abstraction and conceptualization, reasoning about program behavior at different levels of abstraction from hardware to applications.



**Nice to have:** 



* Experience with web services and Flask/Django ecosystem
* Experience with large scale scientific computing and algorithm development
* Long term interest in finance, financial experience is not a requirement.
* Experience contributing to Open-Source projects



 ------------------------------------------------------
 



**Job Family Group:** 



 Risk Management
 
 ------------------------------------------------------
 



**Job Family:** 



 Risk Analytics, Modeling, and Validation
 
 ------------------------------------------------------
 



**Time Type:** 



 Full time
 
 ------------------------------------------------------
 



**Primary Location:** 



 New York New York United States
 
 ------------------------------------------------------
 



**Primary Location Full Time Salary Range:** 



 $142,320.00 - $213,480.00
 
  

 In addition to salary, Citi's offerings may also include, for eligible employees, discretionary and formulaic incentive and retention awards. Citi offers competitive employee benefits, including: medical, dental & vision coverage; 401(k); life, accident, and disability insurance; and wellness programs. Citi also offers paid time off packages, including planned time off (vacation), unplanned time off (sick leave), and paid holidays. For additional information regarding Citi employee benefits, please visit citibenefits.com. Available offerings may vary by jurisdiction, job level, and date of hire.
